Moreover, the reduction in parameters and operations directly contributes to lowering the energy consumption, enabling the deployment of complex models in resource-constrained environments like smartphones and IoT devices. The computational efficiency of these algorithms is also a focus, as managing large datasets in NLP tasks can be resource-intensive. By refining architectural strategies and leveraging efficient sampling, contrastive learning not only enhances generalization across diverse sentence contexts but also adapts well to new datasets with minimal foundational adjustments.

By calculating derivatives, first-order methods provide deeper insight into how each parameter affects the output, leading to more precise and effective pruning results. However, this precision comes at the cost of increased computational resources and complexity, as gradient calculations require additional processing power and time, making first-order methods more resource-intensive in practice.
